name: amateur
content:
amateur

adjective
 
 
/ˈæmətə(r)/,
 
/ˈæmətʃə(r)/
 
/ˈæmətər/,
 
/ˈæmətʃər/
jump to other results
  1. ​
     
    [usually before noun] doing something for pleasure or interest, not as a job
    • an amateur photographer
  2. ​
     
    [usually before noun] done for pleasure, not as a job
    • amateur athletics
  3. ​
     
    (also amateurish)
    (usually disapproving) not done or made well or with skill
    • The performance sounded very amateur, I’m afraid.
    4. opposite professional
See amateur in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: amateur

name: amateur
content:
amateur

noun
 
 
/ˈæmətə(r)/,
 
/ˈæmətʃə(r)/
 
/ˈæmətər/,
 
/ˈæmətʃər/
jump to other results
  1. ​
     
    a person who takes part in a sport or other activity for pleasure, not as a job
    • The tournament is open to both amateurs and professionals.
    Extra Examples
    • I was competing as an amateur.
    • International affairs today are no longer for gentleman amateurs.
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • gifted
    • talented
    • top
    • …
    preposition
    • as an amateur
    See full entry
  2. ​
     
    (usually disapproving) a person who does not have enough skill to be able to do something well
    • This work was done by a bunch of amateurs!
    • The others had been skiing since they could walk and made her look a rank amateur.
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • bumbling
    • complete
    • rank
    • …
    … of amateurs
    • bunch
    See full entry
    3. opposite professional
    Word Originlate 18th cent.: from French, from Italian amatore, from Latin amator ‘lover’, from amare ‘to love’.
See amateur in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: amateur

name: amateurish
content:
amateurish

adjective
 
/ˈæmətərɪʃ/,
 
/ˈæmətʃərɪʃ/
 
/ˈæmətərɪʃ/,
 
/ˈæmətʃərɪʃ/
(also amateur)
(usually disapproving)
jump to other results
  1. ​not done or made well or with skill
    • Detectives described the burglary as ‘crude and amateurish’.
    opposite professional
See amateurish in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: amateurish

name: amateur dramatics
content:
amateur dramatics

noun
 
/ˌæmətə drəˈmætɪks/,
 
/ˌæmətʃə drəˈmætɪks/
 
/ˌæmətər drəˈmætɪks/,
 
/ˌæmətʃər drəˈmætɪks/
 (British English)
(North American English community theater)
[uncountable]
jump to other results
  1. ​the activity of producing and acting in plays for the theatre, by people who do it for pleasure, not as a job
    CultureAmateur dramatics (known as 'am-dram') is very popular in Britain, where there are many amateur dramatics clubs, even in small towns and villages. They perform plays for local people, charging them a small amount in order to pay for the costumes, hall, etc.
    Topics Film and theatrec2, Hobbiesc2
Check pronunciation: amateur dramatics

name: the Amateur Athletic Union
content:
the Amateur Athletic Union

 
/ði ˌæmətər æθˈletɪk juːniən/,
 
/ði ˌæmətʃər æθˈletɪk juːniən/
 
/ði ˌæmətər æθˈletɪk juːniən/,
 
/ði ˌæmətʃər æθˈletɪk juːniən/
(abbreviation the AAU)
jump to other results
  1. ​a non-profit US organization that supports amateur sports. It was established in 1888.
Check pronunciation: the Amateur Athletic Union

name: the Amateur Athletic Association
content:
the Amateur Athletic Association

 
/ði ˌæmətər æθˈletɪk əsəʊsieɪʃn/,
 
/ði ˌæmətər æθˈletɪk əsəʊʃieɪʃn/,
 
/ði ˌæmətʃər æθˈletɪk əsəʊsieɪʃn/,
 
/ði ˌæmətʃər æθˈletɪk əsəʊʃieɪʃn/
 
/ði ˌæmətər æθˈletɪk əsəʊsieɪʃn/,
 
/ði ˌæmətər æθˈletɪk əsəʊʃieɪʃn/,
 
/ði ˌæmətʃər æθˈletɪk əsəʊsieɪʃn/,
 
/ði ˌæmətʃər æθˈletɪk əsəʊʃieɪʃn/
(also the AAA, the Three As)
jump to other results
  1. ​an organization that supports amateur athletics in Britain. It began in 1880, when it was for men only, but in 1991 it combined with the Women's Amateur Athletic Association.
Check pronunciation: the Amateur Athletic Association

name: community theater
content:
community theater

noun
 
/kəˌmjuːnəti ˈθɪətə(r)/
 
/kəˌmjuːnəti ˈθiːətər/
 (North American English)
jump to other results
  1. ​
    (British English amateur dramatics)
     [uncountable] the activity of producing and acting in plays by people who do it for pleasure and not as a job
    • She joined the local community theater in a production of ‘It's a Wonderful Life’.
    Topics Hobbiesc2, Film and theatrec2
  2. ​[countable] a small theatre where these plays are performed
    • The musical has been performed at numerous community theaters in the south-east United States.
    Topics Film and theatrec2
See community theater in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: community theater
